title: 6 Resurrected Gurus Who Christians Can't Ignore!
description:
Learn a Language by Watching TV with our sponsor Lingopie! Start your free trial today: https://learn.lingopie.com/holykoolaid

What if Jesus wasn't the only religious leader whose followers claimed he rose from the dead? Are post-mortem appearances and resurrection stories actually unique to Christianity, or do we find eerily similar patterns across religions worldwide? And why do we give ancient accounts of Jesus's appearances zero scrutiny while dismissing nearly identical modern claims outright, despite them having better evidence?

Today we're exploring six religious figures from the last 150 years whose post-death re-appearances are actually far better attested than Christ's. From Lobsang Rampa (a supposed Tibetan monk who turned out to be a British plumber named Cyril Hoskin) to Sai Baba of Shirdi, whose followers still report physical encounters over a century after his burial. From Sri Ramakrishna and Swami Vivekananda, whose disciples claimed vivid, sensory post-death visitations, to Satya Sai Baba with his potentially 100 million followers. We'll even examine Haile Selassie, Ethiopia's emperor whom Rastafarians worship as the literal second coming of Christ, and whose followers insist he never actually died.

These movements weren't Jesus copycats. Their followers genuinely believed their masters had transcended death, reported dreams, visions, and even physical re-appearances, and built global movements around these resurrection narratives. So what does this tell us about human psychology, grief, and the stories we tell about our departed spiritual leaders? Let's find out.

This is part one of a two-part series. In the next video, we'll examine the bizarre case of Francis Schlatter, the vanishing Messiah, and what his story reveals about an extraordinary aspect of human psychology that no one is talking about.

--

title: Why You Keep Falling For BULLSH*T
description:
In 1995, Carl Sagan warned us about the coming dark age of scientific illiteracy, but he prepared us to battle the wrong enemy! While his toolkit brilliantly equipped us to fight ignorant crystal healers and pyramid schemers, it couldn't defend against adversaries who speak fluent science (and who weaponize that fluency to burn it all down). From Brown & Williamson's tobacco executives spreading medical misinformation about cigarettes to Andrew Wakefield's fraudulent autism study, to deliberate COVID mask misinformation, we'll explore how bad actors learned to exploit science's self-correcting nature and transform honest uncertainty into paralyzing confusion.

Let's explore the difference between legitimate scientific uncertainty and manufactured doubt, uncovering how climate deniers, anti-vaccine grifters, and Russian troll farms turned every normal scientific update into evidence of conspiracy. People have died by the millions because we couldn't distinguish between honest scientific revision and deliberate sabotage. Let's learn to recognize epistemic warfare and discover the crucial addition to Sagan's toolkit that he never saw coming.

title: Everything You Should Have Learned In Science Class... But Didn't!
description:
Why do so many people fall for pseudoscientific scams despite having access to more information than ever before? What's the real difference between legitimate science and the snake oil salesmen flooding social media with dangerous misinformation? And if science is supposed to be our best tool for separating fact from fiction, why does it seem so confusing and contradictory?

The scientific method most of us learned in school‚Äîobservation, hypothesis, experiment, conclusion‚Äîisn't wrong, but it's woefully incomplete. The truth is, science has been evolving for centuries, building layer after layer of safeguards against our pattern-seeking, confirmation-bias-riddled brains. From Roger Bacon's empirical observations in 1265 to the Royal Society's first scientific journal in 1665, from James Lind's controlled scurvy experiments in 1753 to the discovery of the placebo effect in 1937 and double-blind trials in the 1950s... each advancement was designed to outsmart human fallibility and force objectivity where we naturally fail.
Today we'll explore exactly why understanding real science isn't just academic‚Äîit's self-defense against a world drowning in misinformation. 

--

title: How Prophecy Scams Work
description:
Why do prophecies from completely contradictory religions all seem to come true? How can biblical prophets, Nostradamus, and modern televangelists all claim divine accuracy when their predictions should logically cancel each other out? What if every "miraculous" prophecy in history succeeded through the same psychological tricks rather than supernatural insight?

From the Book of Daniel's postdiction scam to Julie Green's shotgun approach on Rumble, false prophets have weaponized nine devastatingly effective techniques to fool billions into believing their guesswork is divine revelation. Today we'll expose exactly how evangelical prophets like those predicting Trump's 2020 victory, Jehovah's Witnesses with their catastrophically failed end-times predictions, and even Jesus himself in Matthew 16:28 have used vagueness, historical revisionism, and social pressure to maintain their prophetic reputations despite spectacular failures. 

We'll examine why Nostradamus's cryptic quatrains have been retrofitted to "predict" everything from Hitler to 9/11, how the Gospel of Matthew invented Herod's massacre to fulfill Jeremiah's prophecy, and why scholars universally agree that Daniel was written centuries after the events it supposedly predicted. title: Everything Wrong with Noah's Ark in 10 minutes
description:
Is Noah‚Äôs Ark actually possible? Does science disprove the flood? And does the global flood myth destroy the credibility of the Bible? Let‚Äôs dive deep into the countless scientific problems faced by Noah‚Äôs Ark and see why it renders this Bible story completely impossible.

Religious institutions often shy away from the many problems plaguing the Noah‚Äôs Ark narrative, or they mislead their audience with incorrect or scientifically bankrupt statements in attempt to defend it. Numerous modern attempts to recreate the Ark have been undertaken (from Johan‚Äôs Ark in the Netherlands, built by Dutch creationist Johan Huibers, to the Ark Encounter in Kentucky, assembled by Ken Ham of Answers in Genesis). At the cost of millions of dollars, these attempts required modern supply chains, high tech power tools, cranes, and massive labor forces and yet still fail to create even remotely seaworthy vessels. And they ignore countless other areas which demonstrate the unlikeliness of this story.

Today we‚Äôll be exploring exactly WHY Noah‚Äôs Ark would be impossible. From fragile marine ecosystems to the insane logistics of properly caring for so many animals with such diverse needs, let‚Äôs breaks down the mathematical, biological, and physical reasons why Noah's Ark couldn't have happened as described in Genesis.

This is Part 2 of our Noah's Ark series. In the first episode, we showed how we can know definitively that a global flood never happened. Check out part 1 here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j6apFLhUjYs

title: How Noah‚Äôs Ark Debunks the WHOLE Bible
description:
Could the story of Noah's Ark actually be true? Is there evidence of a global flood? Does science conflict with the Bible? 40% of Americans still believe in a literal global flood, but the evidence tells a completely different story. Today we'll be exploring 12 undeniable pieces of scientific evidence that prove beyond any doubt that the Earth was never entirely submerged underwater.

From ancient ice cores in Antarctica and Greenland, lake varves in Japan, and tree rings spanning thousands of years, to archaeological finds, delicate coral reefs, and cave formations that have survived hundreds of thousands of years‚Äîeach clue dismantles the global flood myth.

We'll also explore genetic diversity that contradicts a global extinction event, intact ancient soil microbiomes, continuous written records predating the supposed flood, and how flood myths themselves reveal localized rather than global events.

title: The ABSURD True Story of America‚Äôs Weirdest Witch Hunt (and Why It‚Äôs Happening Again)
description:
How did America fall victim to the most ridiculous mass hysteria in modern history? What sparked the nationwide fear that Satan was lurking in daycare centers, rock music, and even Dungeons & Dragons? Journey back to the 1980s when Ronald Reagan was president and America collectively lost its mind during the Satanic Panic, leading to innocent people being imprisoned for impossible crimes like flying on broomsticks and sacrificing babies in non-existent underground tunnels.

From the shocking McMartin Preschool trial that became the longest and most expensive criminal case in American history, to Tipper Gore's crusade against "Satanic" music, this video explores how "recovered memory therapy" and flawed interviewing techniques created false testimonies that ruined countless lives. Featuring key figures like Michelle Smith, Lawrence Pazder, and Raymond Buckey, we trace the devastating human cost of this hysteria and draw uncomfortable parallels to modern conspiracy theories like QAnon and Pizzagate, reminding us what happens when moral panic replaces critical thinking.

title: HORRIFYING Medical Conditions MISTAKEN for DEMONIC POSSESSION! (Part 2)
description:
What if someone you knew suddenly claimed hysterically that their genitals had just been stolen by demonic forces? Or their hand suddenly developed a mind of its own, trying to strangle them in their sleep? Throughout history, these bizarre symptoms were attributed to demonic possession or supernatural forces, leading to exorcisms, violence, and even death.
In this video, I explore the fascinating and disturbing reality of medical conditions mistaken for demonic possession. From fears that someones penis was supernaturally stolen in Nigeria which led to the tragic lynching of 8 innocent missionaries, to Lead Poisoning in mining communities causing hallucinations and convulsions, to Alien Hand Syndrome where limbs seem to have their own sinister agenda, and Hyperthyroidism creating dramatic personality changes that convinced communities of demonic influence.
Learn how superstition, lack of medical knowledge, and belief in the supernatural have led to horrific consequences throughout human history - and continue to do so today. These aren't paranormal phenomena but completely natural, scientifically explainable conditions that deserve proper medical treatment, not exorcisms.
Join me as I debunk demon possession myths while exploring the fascinating intersection of medicine, psychology, culture, and belief. Don't miss this eye-opening look at how science helps us understand what our ancestors mistook for evil forces.

Note: The penis theft story and alien hand syndrome case study are base on actual events. The lead poisoning story is based losely on a description of what people were noticing happening in US lead mines at the time (and backed by the medical literature), but the specific person is hypothetical. The character in the hyperthyroid case is fictional, but is based in a real historical settings and on a real medical condition which has been misunderstood for centuries.

title: HORRIFYING Medical Conditions MISTAKEN for DEMONIC POSSESSION! (Part 1)
description:
Is demon possession real, or are there scientific explanations for what looks like supernatural encounters? Have we mistaken neurological disorders and medical conditions for signs of demonic activity throughout history? From medieval exorcisms to modern-day spiritual warfare, countless people have attributed hallucinations, seizures, and erratic behavior to the influence of dark forces. But as science advances, we now understand that conditions like Anti-NMDA Receptor Encephalitis, Temporal Lobe Epilepsy, Sydenham‚Äôs Chorea (St. Vitus Dance), Ergotism ("St. Anthony's Fire"), and Cotard‚Äôs Delusion have been misinterpreted as possessions for centuries. What was once seen as the work of demons or witches has been uncovered as neurological misfires, autoimmune disorders, and even fungal poisoning‚Äîall treatable with medicine, not exorcisms.

From the Salem Witch Trials to Joan of Arc‚Äôs divine visions, history is littered with tragic cases of misdiagnosed supernatural events. Ergot-contaminated bread caused mass hysteria. Autoimmune diseases sent people into terrifying psychotic episodes. Seizures brought visions of heaven and hell. And yet, many still believe in possession today. This video dives into the real causes behind so-called demon possessions, exposing the medical mysteries that masqueraded as supernatural battles. If you‚Äôve ever wondered whether science has debunked exorcisms, or if demons are just a relic of human misunderstanding, then you won‚Äôt want to miss this.

description:

This story was originally published in Jack Coe's magazine as proof of miracles and evidence for God's healing power. But is it really? You be the judge.

title: The Preacher Who Scammed America
description:
Jack Coe the faith healer who kickstarted a nation-wide faith healing tent revival before landing himself in jail for practicing medicine without a license would con hundreds of thousands of Americans out of millions of dollars. He built a small empire, packed out arenas, and traveled the US in the world's largest tent - claiming he possessed the gift of healing and spoke words of prophecy during the uncertain times of the Cold War. Joining the ranks of Oral Roberts, A. A. Allen, and William Branham, Jack Coe helped create the blueprint that laid the grounds for the modern faith healing con used by many health and wealth prosperity doctrine preachers today.

After working closely with Gordon Lindsay, editing the Voices of Healing Magazine, Reverend Jack Coe launched his own magazine, the Herald of Healing which reached over 300,000 members. Although he was exposed as a faith healing charlatan by Adon Taft of the Miami Herald, Pastor Jack Coe amassed a fortune while offering nothing but false hope and deception before the pastor died of polio at just 38 years old.

title: Calling out Abuse in the Atheist Community
description:
How can you spot abusive behavior and what makes a community abusive? At the 2022 Better Conference (BetterCon), Thomas Westbrook gave this talk calling out abusive behavior in the atheist community, but the points in this talk are fairly universal to all communities. We need to recognize online abuse and learn how can you mitigate or avoid abusive behavior, whether it's harassments on social media or in-person bullying. There can be abusive bullies in any community, but in order to build a healthy community, it's important to spot problematic behavior and to avoid being toxic or abusive ourselves. Here are some of the red flags/warning signs of abuse.

--

00:00 Introduction
00:28 My experience with abuse
01:28 Gray rocking
03:26 Signs of abuse: constant criticism
05:04 Signs of abuse: belittling and shaming
06:13 Signs of abuse: blame-lumping
09:49 Signs of abuse: isolation and shunning
10:48 Signs of abuse: controlling who others associate with
11:52 Signs of abuse: gaslighting
12:39 Signs of abuse: giving people no space
13:23 Signs of abuse: purity testing
16:30 Signs of abuse: constantly looking for a fight
17:15 How to do better
17:37 Understanding how peoples' minds work
24:30 Don't be like Ignaz
27:17 Hanlon's razor and erring on the side of compassion
28:24 Q&A Question 1: Is there a place for firebrands?
30:16 Q&A Question 2: The time/place for anger
31:09 Q&A Question 3: How to change abuse into something good
36:21 Q&A Question 4: How people grow/change gradually over time
38:13 Announcement: NaNoCon in Tennessee
38:35 Outro & Special Thanks

title: What If God Wasn't Divine?
description:
If our universe was created, why do we assume that creator has to be divine? What if our creator wasn't omnipotent, omniscient, or omnipresent? Why does God have to be supernatural at all? Here are 7 different scenarios in which our universe could have been created by an entirely natural, mortal, limited creator.

title: Christianity's Fatal Error
description:
The problem of instruction is Christianity's biggest problem. Is the Bible perfect, literal, and inerrant? Or are there mistakes in the Bible? How was the Bible written and who wrote the Old Testament and New Testament? Why is it so hard to understand and correctly interpret? If an omnipotent, omnibenevolent, omniscient, and omnipresent God crafted such an important message for his children, we should expect it to be omni-coherent. Instead, we have altered copies of manuscripts - a convoluted anonymous mess riddled with scientific blunders, historical inaccuracies and anachronisms, internal contradictions, and failed prophecies. Let's explore the Bible and how it was written to see exactly why the Problem of Instruction is Christianity's Fatal Error.

--

title: Did Jesus Even Exist?
description:
Did Jesus actually exist or was Jesus based on a myth? New Testament scholar Dr. Bart Ehrman explores the historical evidence for Jesus Christ and debunks mythicist claims about him. Dr. Ehrman is a professor of religious studies at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and is the author of 30 books including, Did Jesus Exist? and Misquoting Jesus.

In recent years, mythicism has become increasingly popular, especially in atheist circles, with books by Dr. Richard Carrier, Dr. Robert Price, and others, but is there any validity to mythicist claims? Is Jesus mythicism just a kooky conspiracy theory, or is there reason to doubt the existence of Jesus?

Check out Bart Ehrman's Webinar: https://holykoolaid--ehrman.thrivecart.com/bart-webinar/

description:

title: Nothing Fails Like Bible History 10: Joshua, Jericho, & Genocide
description:
Did the story of Jericho really happen? Did Joshua actually destroy Jericho and invade Canaan, or is the Biblical conquest of Canaan actually true? Is the Bible historical? If not, how much of the Bible is true and how much of the Bible is myth or legend. In this episode of Nothing Fails Like Bible History, discover just how much of the Biblical story of the conquest of Canaan is fact, supported by archaeology, and how much is fiction - either debunked or unsupported by the archaeological evidence.

--

title: Unearthing the True Origins of the Bible
description:
How much of the Old Testament is true? Is the Bible historical? And if not, where did the Jewish people come from and how did Judaism originate? In this interview, Dr. Andrew Henry, a religious studies expert from the Religion for Breakfast channel, discusses the Israeli ethnogenesis, the archaeology of the Levant, and how Judaism emerged in Canaan. Did the Exodus happen? Did Joshua invade Canaan? Was there a grand united kingdom of Israel under King David? And if not, then what's the source, origin, and reason for these Old Testament stories?

title: The St. Elisabeth Monastery Scandal
description:
As the coronavirus pandemic was sweeping through Belarus, The St. Elisabeth Monastery tried to hide the outbreak in their church. Even as hundreds of nuns, priests, and members became sick, they continued to hold packed services with no social distancing and discouraged people from wearing masks. Father Andrew Lemeshonok told the nuns to lie about the spread of the infection and told his congregation that churches were places of healing and that you can't get sick from holy communion even when you share a spoon with sick people and kiss the same icons. To keep the scandal under wraps, the leadership of the monastery resorted to cult-like tactics, discouraging nuns from even reaching out to friends and family.

title: Nothing Fails Like Bible History - Episode 6
description:

title: Confronting America's Most Hateful Preacher
description:
My street confrontation with Pastor Steven Anderson outside of the Make America Straight Again Conference exposes his anti-LGBT views and what his horrific alternative to gay rights is.

Pastor Anderson held the Make America Straight Again Conference in Orlando, Florida on the anniversary of the Pulse Nightclub shooting and his religious denomination (the NIFB) celebrated the attack on gays. I caught him as he was leaving the conference and shot this interview while I was protesting the MASA conference.

description:
Trolling Pastor Tommy McMurtry of the NIFB's Make America Straight Again Conference in a giant pumpkin costume the day after we protested this awful event.

The rumor that Pastor McMurtry may or may not be attracted to pumpkins was started by Mr. Atheist (Jimmy Snow) after Tommy McMurtry, of the New Independent Fundamental Baptist church - Liberty Baptist called Jimmy Mr. Pumpkin because he was the, "Biggest fruit on earth."

Hearing this rumor, Thomas Westbrook (a member of the Pumpkin Posse) decided to travel to Orlando, Florida to the MASA conference in a giant pumpkin outfit to find out for sure if the rumors about Tommy McMurtry are true.

title: Protesting the Make America Straight Again Conference
description:
The Make America Straight Again Conference held by the New Independent Fundamental Baptists (NIFB) - a hate group that advocates for the death of LGBT members was in Orlando, Florida last weekend. Their conference was held during pride month on the anniversary of the Pulse Nightclub shooting. This is a recap of our peaceful protest of the NIFB's MASA conference.

Pastor Steven Anderson, Tommy McMurtry, Patrick Boyle, Bruce Mejia and Roger Jimenez were a few of the homophobic pastors advocating for the death of gay people. We stood in firm opposition, countering their message of hate with one of love.

title: The Case for Abortion that Every Pro-Lifer Needs to Hear (Ft. Rachel Oates)
description:
Rachel Oates joins Thomas Westbrook to make the case for abortion and why it should be both legal and hassle-free. Together they explore the history of abortion and the pro-life vs. pro-choice arguments, the science of abortion and personhood, and why it should be a woman's right to choose and should be legal.

Thomas looks at the consequences of restricting abortion access and some of the harm done by the pro-life movement/how the actions pro-lifers take are causing way more harm than they realize. And finally, Rachel provides healthy alternatives that effectively bring down the rate of abortions without making them illegal.

This is the case for legal abortion featuring Rachel Oates & Thomas Westbrook, and every pro-lifer needs to understand this side.

This is just part 1 in a two-part collaboration with Rachel Oates about abortion. Check out part 2 here: https://youtu.be/qn_7X9t3xTs

title: Apathy is Digging your Grave - Thomas Westbrook (International Atheist Day 2019)
description:
At the first annual International Atheist Day, Thomas Westbrook of Holy Koolaid gave a talk about religion and the harm it's causing. The theme of the talk was, "You are Being Screwed," and in it, he discussed how scientific progress has occurred in the teeth of religious opposition, and religion is still a great cause for harm in the world. International Atheist Day is an Atheist Republic event, organized to bring atheists all over the world together, to come out of the atheist closet, stand up for the rights of the non-religious, and destigmatize atheism.

The event in Austin was organized by the Atheist Community of Austin, in conjunction with Atheist Republic and the Center for Inquiry.

#AtheistDay #AtheistDay2019 #InternationalAtheistDay

title: What Religious People Don't Understand About Location
description:
Religious people don't seem to understand that location is relative. Space is an illusion based on your frame of reference and every molecule on earth is shifting/shuffling around like a planetary bowl of porridge. Even the continents are moving. For this reason, the notion of a holy land or sacred place is altogether laughable. No god would choose something so dynamic as a holy land without being entirely human-like in its small-minded delusions.

title: The Most Brutal Psychic Fail Compilation Pt. 1
description:
The best collection of psychic fails. Watch Theresa Caputo, John Edward, Sylvia Browne, Derek Acorah, Sally Morgan, and many others fail miserably in this epic compilation of psychic blunders, mistakes, failed predictions, and lies. Watch these mediums epic fail when they appear on other peoples' shows where they can't control the edits. Several psychics fail to prove their paranormal claims while attempting to win the James Randi Educational Foundation (JREF) Million Dollar Challenge. These self-proclaimed psychics fail big: Theresa Caputo exposed on Anderson Cooper, John Edward fails at cold reading, Sylvia Browne mistakenly says a living person is dead. James Van Praagh makes a fool of himself in front of a live audience. Sally Morgan pretends to hear the voice of a dead grandmother, without realizing she's channeling based on the picture of a grandfather. Confirmation bias, shotgunning tactics, Barnum statements, hot reading, and cold reading, can fool many people, but only when you're not looking for the psychic misses during a psychic reading. When you don't focus on the hits and ignore the misses, it's obvious how fraudulent these supernatural claims are.

Watch my full Exposing Psychics playlist here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GITxVhvDlig&list=PLCTNr4WPOQ97HRxlAVg5HCPC5IixISI-M&index=1

title: The Magician James Randi on the Importance of Skepticism
description:
James Randi, the legendary magician, skeptic, and paranormal debunker talks about the importance of scientific skepticism and how his work as a magician has shaped the way he views the world. James "The Amazing Randi" has spent decades in show business as a magician, but as a psychic investigator and debunker of the paranormal, Randi stresses the fact that it's all an artful deception and not supernatural at all - earning him the nickname "An Honest Liar." In this interview, James Randi discusses his work as a magician and the importance of being skeptical.

title: What is the Meaning of Life as an Atheist? (Finding Meaning without God)
description:
What is the meaning of life? What is the purpose of life? The problem with these questions is the word "the." As if there's only one. Pastors often ask how you can have meaning without God. But to quote Dan Barker, this is like asking, "without a master, whose slave will I be?" The beauty of life is that as an atheist you're free to find your own meaning - finding beauty, purpose, and happiness in the things that mean something to you.

--

title: Islam - Behind the Veil
description:
Women in Islam often have no voice & are persecuted for speaking up. Honor killings, beatings, stonings, beheadings, forced female genital mutilations, and restricted rights are common throughout the Muslim world, but often those who speak against it are told that that's just their culture and it's racist/islamophobic to speak out. But this is bullshit, and it's bigotry of low expectations. It's time to fight for equality for women. Enough is enough, and it's time we speak out and fight for the rights of those who have no voice.

title: 5 Mistakes People Make When Coming Out Atheist
description:
Coming out Atheist can be difficult. But there are steps you can take to make coming out of the atheist closet a bit easier. 13 countries have death penalties for apostasy. Many others have less severe punishments for apostasy or have blasphemy laws. Even in the west people face blowback from family, friends, teachers, and co-workers. Here are 5 mistakes people make when coming out atheist. As you leave the faith, hopefully avoiding these mistakes will make your journey out of the atheist closet easier. For part 2 check out my guest appearance on the Common Heathens podcast with Godless mom and Mr. Oz Atheist.

title: The Holy Koolaid Origin Story
description:
Welcome to Holy Koolaid where we explore big ideas through a lens of scientific skepticism and break them down in a laser-focused easy to understand way. This video is my origin story.

Connect with me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/holykoolaid

I'm Thomas Westbrook, and this is the story of how I fell in love with science and went from being a missionary kid in a former Soviet, Muslim country to being a full-time science communicator and secular activist. This is the backstory of Holy Koolaid where we question everything because free thought and curiosity help us inoculate ourselves against abusive control tactics and bad ideas. Thanks for joining me on this adventure in my quest for truth.

I'm looking forward to seeing more of you around here, so don't forget to hit that subscribe button!

title: Atheist Rant: Enough Whataboutery! (Diversion Apologetics)
description:
Atheist rant time! Stop using diversion apologetics - an argument by deflection - shifting the blame to another religion when someone points out the problems with your religion. What about Islam? What about Christianity? Enough whataboutery! I'm an atheist. Why do I have to pick my favorite pile of horse shit?

In this ranting diatribe, responding to religious apologetics, I take on argumentation by deflection. Whataboutism is a subtle admission of guilt. This diversion tactic is the equivalent of saying, "look over there." It solves nothing and impedes progress, and it's a last-ditch effort/futile attempt to distract, by those uncomfortable with the fact that their religion has problems.

--

If you enjoyed this rant, check out this other one: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pLOcWHePJDA

title: Interview with Seth Andrews - Host of the Largest Atheist Podcast (The Thinking Atheist)
description:
In this interview with Seth Andrews, we talk about the necessity of critical thinking and fostering curiosity in a world that celebrates ignorance. Seth is the host of The Thinking Atheist (the largest atheist radio podcast in the world). He is a former Christian radio host and the author of the books Deconverted: A Journey from Religion to Reason and Sacred Cows: A Lighthearted Look at Belief and Tradition Around the World. The Thinking Atheist community was created by Seth Andrews as a way to encourage fellow non-believers and to show us that we're not alone. Join us as we talk about his history with the Thinking Atheist Radio Podcast and his mission to encourage the world to assume nothing, question everything, and start thinking.

title: Near Death Experiences Explained - Truth About NDEs
description:
Can near-death experiences be explained by science? What's the truth about NDEs? Fear not: there's no evidence of the supernatural. Modern brain science has yielded interesting new studies (such as the Aware Study by Dr. Sam Parnia, Olaf Blanke's work with electrodes stimulating the brain, and Dr. Michael Persinger's god helmet) that all seem to indicate that near-death experiences are entirely a construct of the brain. It's extremely unlikely that there's life after death as Dr. Jeffrey Long believes or "life after life" as Raymond Moody puts it, which means we don't need to be afraid of hell, and we should seize the day and make the most of this life.

--

title: Atheist Rant: Why can't theists understand this?!
description:
Atheist rant time: I'm fed up with hearing people get offended because I don't accept their religion. I don't get offended that they "reject" my atheism! Why do theists feel rejected? They think I'm somehow rejecting THEM personally because they've made their religion a part of their identity. But like arrows in a quiver, our beliefs should be interchangeable based on evidence. Instead, people have made their beliefs the quiver itself - making them a part of their identity crisis, and then they get offended when you reject their beliefs because they think you're rejecting them, and they have an identity crisis when they realize that that belief is false. But all ideas should be scrutinized and up for debate. No idea is sacred.

More things theists can't understand:

title: Sleep Paralysis Explained
description:
Have you ever been possessed by demons? Is demon possession real or what's really going on? Sleep paralysis is extremely common, but those who don't know what's happening often think it's demons, aliens, ghosts, or spirits. Fortunately, science can show us what's really going on in the brain during sleep paralysis and we no longer have to be afraid of the supernatural.

--

title: How to overcome fear
description:
Overcoming fear is difficult, but, you don't have to be afraid. You can overcome your fear of the supernatural, demonic powers, spiritual forces, curses, witchcraft, and the dead. There are too many frightening things in this world to lose sleep over irrational fears of the paranormal. Fear leads us to do irrational things and to not always act in our best interest. But the supernatural can be explained, whether you're experiencing a hypnagogic hallucination or hypnopompic hallucinations during sleep paralysis or are under the influence of psychedelic drugs; whether you've had near-death experiences, or are encountering fear-inducing infrasounds or seeing things because of sleep deprivation. Motor neurons make us experience other people's fears, causing mass-hysteria. Pareidolia makes us think we see faces and figures where there are none. Science can help explain to us what's really going on in the brain when we encounter what we think is supernatural, and it can free us of our fears by making the unknown known.

--

title: Can prophecy predict the END times?
description:
Do prophecies prove god? Is there anyone who can see the future or predict the end times? Does fortunetelling work? Unfortunately, there‚Äôs no evidence that anyone has pre-cognition. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you‚Äôre using tarot cards or crystal balls, no one can predict the end of the world using their gut feelings. Prophecy is not real but is extremely malleable. To demonstrate this, I use Nostradamus to ‚Äúpredict‚Äù after the fact that Kim Kardashian‚Äôs butt will go viral on the internet. So the next time you flip the channel to a televangelist prophet of doom or meet a guy in a sandwich board yelling that the end is near, you can chuckle and know that the end times aren‚Äôt at hand, and the apocalypse isn‚Äôt worth losing sleep over. Life is short, so enjoy it and stop living in fear.

--

title: Dare to be curious - think critically üöÄ
description:
Be curious and think critically. Ask the hard questions, because the notion that ancient civilizations had everything figured out and are somehow wiser because they‚Äôve been dead longer is insane. If anything, society is older now. We are the ancients, not those pondering existence in the infancy of civilization. We see further because we stand on the shoulders of giants, but we still see further. But progress is only made when we dare to be curious, to think for ourselves, and to question the status quo. Don‚Äôt be afraid to ask and explore difficult questions. The repercussions can be harsh, but you are not alone.

--

title: Weird Science by Victor Harris Jr. - Inspirational Poetry about the Cosmos
description:
WEIRD SCIENCE by Victor Harris Jr. is a secular, inspirational poem about the cosmos. Victor Harris Jr. is a skeptic, humanist, atheist, and poet with a passion for science. His love of science comes alive through inspirational poetry and uplifting science-based verses quoting the likes of Stephen Hawking and Carl Sagan while reflecting on our place in the Cosmos.

Get Holy Koolaid Merchandise: https://teespring.com/stores/holykoolaid

Transcript:
I am an amazing amalgamation of milliseconds;
A compilation of coincidences;
A collection of infinitely small spans of time that separates me from the possibility of my bloodline.
I have managed to outswim 500 million of my brothers and sisters to be here today ‚Äì continuing a chain of happenstance that began moments after the big bang brought the universe into being.
Matter and energy cannot be created or destroyed, so the same molecules that make up me in this instance have been in existence for over 13 billion years!
We are heavenly, but there is no godly hand evident in the creation of man.
I can instead trace evidence of my being into the cosmos.
The same elements that make me unique have been sourced to create the universe.
I mean, forget Jesus; stars died.
Galaxies gave their lives to form my fingertips.
How could I not find wonder in waking up, be more amazed at each day that I am granted more time on this little blue marble, floating through the vast emptiness of space?
I am in awe of life.
To quote Carl Sagan:
‚ÄúI find it elevating and exhilarating to discover, that we live in a universe which permits the evolution of molecular machines as intricate and subtle as we.‚Äù
I am left breathless by the understanding that my continuance is an example of the improbable vs. the impossible, and despite what some might think, this makes my life more precious ‚Äì makes each day more valuable ‚Äì lends weight and reality to the precious actuality of each person that I allow into my life because I see that they are an amazing amalgamation of milliseconds, a compilation of coincidences, a collection of infinitely small spans of time that separates them from the possibility of their bloodline. So I offer assistance where I‚Äôm able, compassion when I can, and a hug when life‚Äôs weight proves too great for them to stand because these memories will be the markers of my legacy ‚Äì allowing me to exist for eternity ‚Äì or at least, a few years past my mental exit from this planet, a few years past my physical exit from this planet, a few years past that moment in time when my atoms are reconnected with the cosmos.
I live my life relaxed and happy because I know that I could be gone tomorrow.  And like Stephen Hawking said,
‚ÄúWhen your expectations have been reduced to zero, do you truly appreciate everything you have.‚Äù

More work by Victor Harris Jr.:
http://poetvictorharrisjr.com/

Victor also owns and operates Reuschell‚Äôs Cheesecakes in the San Francisco, East Bay Area.
http://www.reuschelles.com

title: What is Street Epistemology? Interview with Anthony Magnabosco (what is SE?)
description:
What is Street Epistemology? In this interview with Street Epistemologist, Anthony Magnabosco, we talk about how using the Socratic Method (asking questions) can create doxastic openness with our interlocutors.

In 2013, Dr. Peter Boghossian published the book A Manual for Creating Atheists which detailed a far less hostile way to persuade people out of harmful and dogmatic beliefs using questions rather than heated debate or argumentation, calling it the method Street Epistemology.

One early adopter of the method, Anthony Magnabosco, believing doubt is a gift, has been testing it out and filming the results. They have been astonishingly effective at sowing doubt and fostering a healthy level of skepticism. This week I had the opportunity to interview him.

description:
Is the god of the Bible a just god? While the Bible claims so, a closer inspection reveals that if that the god of the Bible is entirely unjust, and if any god exists, he would be either apathetic, entirely absent, or tyrannically evil. In this video, we look at just what is justice, and what makes a punishment just or unjust.

title: Does religion kill curiosity?
description:
Does religion kill curiosity? Does faith hamper the scientific method? Is there a conflict between faith and religion? Traditionally Christian patriarchs have discouraged curiosity and exploration, but it's OK to think for yourself, and start asking the hard questions because truth withstands scrutiny!
